attributes.action: Honour Harry Patch with a state funeral now that he has died, as the 'last' of the fighting men of WW1
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: Now that Mr Harry Patch has died,(25th July 2009), It is only right and proper that we mark and honour his passing with a significant ceremony to show the country’s appreciation, thanks, and gratitude to this Gentleman and to all those who died during, or had to suffer the lasting consequences of the war to end all wars

rejection.details: The Cabinet Office is actively seeking nominations for honours from the public. Please go to http://www.direct.gov.uk/honours
reasons: Issues for which an e-petition is not the appropriate channel
